intro: Hymenoxys herbacea, commonly known as the hairy leaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features showy yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, often with a rough texture. Hymenoxys herbacea is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
